A good scenario needs to be epic.  My friend and I used to play version 1.5 
on level 11 all the time.  We would hide in the southwest corner (I was a 
druid; he was a thief).  I would just plant trees for him to blow up and 
then when the enemy had killed each other off... that was back when it was a 
tough level.  I dunno what happened after that version of the demo, but it 
seems much easier now.  Ah, those were the days.

Back on subject, we though that was a good scenario because it took some 
work and thinking on our part.  Unfortunately, there are some levels that 
are just too big and hard.  In the current version, there's a level with 
Blue and Green ghosts and skeletons.  It's in a cave-like place (I don't 
remember the number), but the thing that sucks about it is the inablility to 
move for 20 minutes after being scared into a corner with 10-20 other 
creatures.  That may be the fault of the 'scare' function, though.  Ah well.

In all, I think bigger levels are better, and varied terrain is good.  
Levels like 14 and 15 are nice and big, but there isn't enough variation in 
them.
